entities.description: "GloVe is an organization that provides word embeddings for natural language processing tasks."
"Arora et al. are researchers who have published work on sentence embeddings and their application in controlling response-relatedness."
"Baheti et al. are researchers who have described a method similar to the one used for controlling response-relatedness in this text."
"Table 2 is an example provided in the text to illustrate the control of response-relatedness via weighted decoding."
"images/image_3.jpg is a reference to an image file, likely containing visual data related to the topic of response-relatedness control."
"word emb (w) refers to the GloVe embedding for the word w, which is a numerical representation of the word in a vector space."
"sent emb (ℓ) is the sentence embedding for the partner’s last utterance ℓ, which is part of the context x."
"cos sim stands for cosine similarity, a measure used to determine the similarity between two vectors."
"utterance s refers to a specific instance of speech or text being considered within the context of the conversation."
"partner’s last utterance ℓ is the most recent statement made by the conversation partner, which is used to calculate the cosine similarity with the model's response."
"model’s response y is the output generated by the model in response to the partner’s last utterance ℓ."
"weighted decoding is a method used to control the semantic relatedness of the model’s response to the partner’s last utterance."

A method used to control question-asking in dialogue systems, with the ability to adjust the rate of questions asked by the model. It is effective in controlling question-asking at the distributional, dialogue level, and preferable to weighted decoding as it allows achieving a range of question rates without introducing the risk of degenerate output. It requires retraining and examples of the controllable attribute but is safer and more direct in capturing the attribute of interest compared to weighted decoding.
"control variable z is defined as the cosine similarity between the partner’s last utterance ℓ and the model’s response y."

relationships.description: "Arora et al. reference the GloVe embeddings in their work on controlling response-relatedness."
"The method of controlling response-relatedness using GloVe embeddings is similar to the method described by Baheti et al."
"Arora et al. use Table 2 to demonstrate the effectiveness of weighted decoding in controlling response-relatedness."
"Table 2 provides an example of a method similar to what Baheti et al. have described for controlling response-relatedness."
"word emb (w) is the GloVe embedding for the word w, provided by the GloVe organization."
"sent emb (ℓ) is calculated using the GloVe embeddings of the words in the partner’s last utterance ℓ."
"cos sim is used to calculate the cosine similarity between sent emb (ℓ) and the model’s response y."
"Conditional training is used to define the control variable z, which is related to managing response-relatedness."

entities.description: A method used to control question-asking in dialogue systems, with the ability to adjust the rate of questions asked by the model. It is effective in controlling question-asking at the distributional, dialogue level, and preferable to weighted decoding as it allows achieving a range of question rates without introducing the risk of degenerate output. It requires retraining and examples of the controllable attribute but is safer and more direct in capturing the attribute of interest compared to weighted decoding.
"Weighted decoding is another method used to control question-asking in dialogue systems, which can encourage or discourage questions by assigning weights to interrogative words."
"Question-asking is the act of inquiring information within a dialogue, which is controlled in this context to study the trade-offs between too few or too many questions."
"Human evaluation is the process considered for assessing the dialogue system's performance in controlling question-asking using the conditional training method."
"The model refers to the dialogue system being trained and evaluated for its ability to control question-asking and maintain semantic relatedness in responses."
"The control variable $z$ is used in conditional training to represent different settings for controlling question-asking rates in the model's responses."

entities.entity_name: "$\MATHTT{C O S\_S I M}(\MATHTT{S E N T\_E M B}(Y),\MATHTT{S E N T}$ EMB(ℓ))"
entities.description: "The overall cosine similarity between the partner’s last utterance and the model’s response, used as an ineffective method to control response-relatedness."
"A binary decoding feature that indicates whether a word is an interrogative, used in weighted decoding to control question-asking."
"An instance of speech or writing, considered in the context of whether it contains a question mark or not, used to define the control variable $z$ for conditional training."
"A feature that discourages bigrams that have appeared in previous utterances, used in weighted decoding but causing a reduction in question-asking rates."
"An extra setting introduced to allow the model to produce necessary question-asking bigrams without the extrep bigram feature during beam search."
"Appendix F is referenced as the location where exact numbers related to the control methods and their effects can be found."

relationships.description: "Conditional training is used to control the rate of question-asking in dialogue systems, allowing for a range of question-asking rates."
"Weighted decoding influences question-asking by assigning weights to interrogative words, though it has unintended side-effects."
"The model is trained using conditional training to control question-asking, with the ability to produce a range of question rates."
"The model's performance is affected by weighted decoding, which can influence question-asking but risks degenerate output."
"Human evaluation is used to assess the effectiveness of conditional training in controlling question-asking."
"The control variable $z$ is used in the conditional training of the CT model to control the rate of question-asking in the model's responses."
"The binary decoding feature is qn word $(w)$ is integral to the weighted decoding method, used to control question-asking by assigning weights to interrogative words."
"The extrep bigram feature is part of the weighted decoding process, which can discourage necessary bigrams for question-asking, leading to reduced rates."
"The $z\;=\;10\;(b o o s t)$ setting is an adjustment made to the CT model to improve question-asking rates by allowing certain bigrams during beam search."

entities.description: "Weighted Decoding Models are a set of models being evaluated for their performance in engagingness and fluency in conversational aspects."
"Repetition-Controlled Baseline is a model used for comparison in the study, focusing on repetition control in conversational aspects."
"Gold Data serves as a benchmark in the study, representing the standard against which the models are compared for specificity."

A method used to control question-asking in dialogue systems, with the ability to adjust the rate of questions asked by the model. It is effective in controlling question-asking at the distributional, dialogue level, and preferable to weighted decoding as it allows achieving a range of question rates without introducing the risk of degenerate output. It requires retraining and examples of the controllable attribute but is safer and more direct in capturing the attribute of interest compared to weighted decoding.
"Human Evaluation is the process where crowdworkers rate the models on various conversational aspects such as responsiveness and interestingness."
"A/B Interestingness Evaluation is a specific test conducted to compare the interestingness of different specificity-controlled models against the repetition-controlled baseline."
"Crowdworkers are individuals who participate in the human evaluation process, providing ratings and feedback on the models' performance."
"PersonaChat Task is the conversational task used in the study to evaluate the models' ability to engage in interesting and coherent conversations."
"Figure 3 is referenced in the text to discuss the performance of different models in terms of engagingness and specificity."
"Figure 4 is mentioned alongside Figure 3 to discuss the performance of the Specificity and Question controlled models."
"Appendix H is referenced for further discussion on control settings and their evaluation in terms of response-relatedness."
"images/image_7.jpg is mentioned as a source for additional visual data related to the study."
"Table 3 is referenced to show A/B tests comparing various specificity-controlled models to the repetition-controlled baseline on interestingness."
"Figure 7 is mentioned in the context of the A/B interestingness evaluation process."

relationships.description: "Weighted Decoding Models are compared against the Repetition-Controlled Baseline to evaluate their performance in engagingness and fluency."
"Weighted Decoding Models are evaluated in relation to Gold Data to determine their specificity and engagingness."
"CT Model is compared to the Repetition-Controlled Baseline to assess its performance in engagingness and fluency."
"Crowdworkers participate in the Human Evaluation process, providing ratings that help assess the models' performance."
"Crowdworkers are involved in the A/B Interestingness Evaluation, where they rate the models' interestingness."
"The PersonaChat Task is the subject of the Human Evaluation, where models are rated on their conversational abilities."
"Figure 3 is used to evaluate and compare the Weighted Decoding Models with the Repetition-Controlled Baseline."
"Figure 4 is used to discuss the performance of the Weighted Decoding Models in comparison to the Repetition-Controlled Baseline."
"Table 3 presents the results of the A/B Interestingness Evaluation, showing significant improvements in interestingness for certain models."
"Figure 7 provides details on the A/B interestingness evaluation process, including the presentation of two conversations to crowdworkers."

entities.description: "Kulikov et al. is referenced in the context of n-gram blocking, indicating their contribution to the field."
"Normalized Inverse Document Frequency (NIDF) is used as a measure of word rareness to control specificity in sequence-to-sequence models."
"R represents the number of responses in the dataset, used in the calculation of Inverse Document Frequency (IDF)."
"c_w represents the number of responses containing a specific word w, used in the calculation of Inverse Document Frequency (IDF)."
"min.idf is the minimum IDF value, used in the normalization of IDF to calculate NIDF."
"max.idf is the maximum IDF value, used in the normalization of IDF to calculate NIDF."
"resp rel is a decoding feature used to control response-relatedness in conversational models."
"Weighted decoding is a technique used to control conversational attributes by adjusting the probability of words based on their scores with respect to certain features."

A method used to control question-asking in dialogue systems, with the ability to adjust the rate of questions asked by the model. It is effective in controlling question-asking at the distributional, dialogue level, and preferable to weighted decoding as it allows achieving a range of question rates without introducing the risk of degenerate output. It requires retraining and examples of the controllable attribute but is safer and more direct in capturing the attribute of interest compared to weighted decoding.
"Repetition is one of the conversational attributes controlled in the text, which includes external, internal, and partner repetition."
"Specificity is a conversational attribute controlled by using NIDF to measure word rareness, aiming to produce more specific responses."
"Response-relatedness is a conversational attribute that ensures responses are related to the partner's last utterance in a conversation."
"Question-asking is a conversational attribute that is controlled to maintain an appropriate level of inquiry in conversations."
"External repetition refers to self-repetition across utterances, which is one of the types of repetition controlled in the text."
"Internal repetition refers to self-repetition within utterances, which is one of the types of repetition controlled in the text."
"Partner repetition refers to repeating the conversational partner, which is one of the types of repetition controlled in the text."
"Extrep bigram is a decoding feature that identifies repeating bigrams for external repetition."
"Intrep bigram is a decoding feature that identifies repeating bigrams for internal repetition."
"Partnerrep bigram is a decoding feature that identifies repeating bigrams for partner repetition."
"Extrep unigram is a decoding feature that identifies repeating content words for external repetition."
"Intrep unigram is a decoding feature that identifies repeating content words for internal repetition."

relationships.description: "Kulikov et al.'s work is related to the concept of n-gram blocking, which is connected to the use of NIDF in controlling repetition."
"R is part of the formula used to calculate IDF, which is then used in the calculation of NIDF."
"c_w is part of the formula used to calculate IDF, which is then used in the calculation of NIDF."
"min.idf is used in the normalization process to calculate NIDF from IDF."
"max.idf is used in the normalization process to calculate NIDF from IDF."
"NIDF and resp rel are both used as decoding features to control different attributes in conversational models."
"Weighted decoding is used to control repetition by applying negative weights to specific decoding features."
"Conditional training is used in conjunction with weighted decoding to control repetition in conversational models."
"Weighted decoding uses NIDF as a feature to control the specificity of responses."
"Conditional training is used to control specificity by discretizing mean NIDF into buckets."
"Weighted decoding uses the resp rel feature to control the relatedness of responses."
"Repetition includes external repetition as one of its types."
"Repetition includes internal repetition as one of its types."
"Repetition includes partner repetition as one of its types."

"Conditional Training (CT) is a method used to learn a sequence-to-sequence model with a discrete control variable."
"Weighted Decoding (WD) is a decoding method that increases or decreases the probability of words with certain features."
"Fan et al., 2018 is a reference to a group of researchers who contributed to the development of Conditional Training."
"Kikuchi et al., 2016 is a reference to a group of researchers who contributed to the development of Conditional Training."
"Peng et al., 2018 is a reference to a group of researchers who contributed to the development of Conditional Training."
"Ghazvininejad et al., 2017 is a reference to a group of researchers who contributed to the development of Weighted Decoding."
"The sequence-to-sequence model is a type of model used in the context of Conditional Training and Weighted Decoding."
"The control attribute refers to the attribute of the output that is controlled at the dialogue level in Conditional Training and Weighted Decoding."
"A discrete control variable is used in Conditional Training to represent the control attribute in a binary or bucketed form."
"In Conditional Training, each possible value of the discrete control variable is represented via an embedding."
"The cross-entropy loss is the loss function optimized by the Conditional Training model to learn the sequence-to-sequence model."
"PersonaChat is the training set used to fine-tune the Conditional Training models."
"In Conditional Training, using the control variable as the START symbol for the decoder is one of the ways to condition the sequence-to-sequence model on the control variable."
"RNN refers to the Recurrent Neural Network, which calculates the log-probability of the word in Weighted Decoding."
"In Weighted Decoding, a decoding feature assigns a real value to the word in the context of the text generated so far and the context."
"In Weighted Decoding, the weights associated with decoding features are hyperparameters to be chosen."
"The validation set is used to determine the convergence of lossCT in the fine-tuning of Conditional Training models."

relationships.description: "Fan et al., 2018 contributed to the development of Conditional Training (CT)."
"Kikuchi et al., 2016 contributed to the development of Conditional Training (CT)."
"Peng et al., 2018 contributed to the development of Conditional Training (CT)."
"Ghazvininejad et al., 2017 contributed to the development of Weighted Decoding (WD)."
"Both Conditional Training (CT) and Weighted Decoding (WD) can be applied simultaneously in experiments."
"Conditional Training (CT) is a method to learn a sequence-to-sequence model with a discrete control variable."
"Conditional Training (CT) is used to control attributes of the output at the dialogue level."
"In Conditional Training (CT), a discrete control variable is used to represent the control attribute."
"In Conditional Training (CT), the discrete control variable is represented via an embedding."
"The Conditional Training (CT) model optimizes the cross-entropy loss to learn the sequence-to-sequence model."
"Conditional Training (CT) models are fine-tuned on the PersonaChat training set."
"In Weighted Decoding (WD), the log-probability of the word is calculated by the Recurrent Neural Network (RNN)."
"In Weighted Decoding (WD), a decoding feature assigns a real value to the word in the context of the text generated so far and the context."

entities.description: "Stanford University is an educational institution where some of the authors of the paper are affiliated."
"Facebook AI Research is the organization where some of the authors of the paper are affiliated."
"Abigail See is one of the authors of the paper, affiliated with Stanford University."
"Stephen Roller is one of the authors of the paper, affiliated with Facebook AI Research."
"Douwe Kiela is one of the authors of the paper, affiliated with Facebook AI Research."
"Jason Weston is one of the authors of the paper, affiliated with Facebook AI Research."
"PersonaChat is a task used in the paper to conduct experiments on multi-turn interactive conversations."
"NeurIPS ConvAI2 competition is an event where the best model from the paper matches the performance of the winning entry."
"A reference to a study that discusses the genericness and repetitiveness of responses in neural generation models for dialogue."
Zhang et al. is a research group that has developed the PersonaChat dataset and contributed to the field of controllable neural text generation.
"A reference to the winning entry in the NeurIPS ConvAI2 competition, which the paper's best model matches in performance."
"A reference to a study that discusses dialogue evaluation in goal-oriented tasks."
"A reference to a study that discusses dialogue evaluation in goal-oriented tasks."
"A reference to a study that discusses dialogue evaluation in goal-oriented tasks."
"A reference to a study that discusses dialogue evaluation in goal-oriented tasks."
"A reference to a study that discusses dialogue evaluation in goal-oriented tasks."
"A reference to a study that discusses the PARADISE framework linking task success and dialogue cost to human judgments."
"A reference to a study that discusses the correlation between word-overlap metrics and human judgments in dialogue."
"A reference to a study that discusses the correlation between word-overlap metrics and human judgments in dialogue."
"A reference to a study that discusses adversarial evaluation in dialogue tasks."
"A reference to a study that discusses learning a scoring model for dialogue evaluation."
"A reference to a study that uses automatic metrics for dialogue evaluation without human study."
"A reference to a study that uses automatic metrics for dialogue evaluation without human study."
"A reference to a study that discusses dialogue evaluation using human evaluations."
"A reference to a study that discusses dialogue evaluation using human evaluations."
Li et al. is a research group that has worked on single-turn response generation with control and contributed to the field of controllable neural text generation.
"A reference to a study that discusses a comprehensive evaluation strategy for dialogue within the scope of the Alexa prize."
"A reference to a study that discusses a comprehensive evaluation strategy for dialogue within the scope of the Alexa prize."
